Comments_List: I gained knowledge and insights around the work of Machado de Assis; before the course I had only read perhaps his best known work, Dom Casmurro.

I thought one of the strengths of the course was the instructor, Professor Jackson, and his remarkable and enthusiastic command of the topic. If there was a weakness, I suppose it would have to do with having few opportunities for students to lead the discussion.
I would recommend the course to students who are both looking to improve their Portuguese and gain knowledge on one of Brazil's most important writers of the 19th century.
